records.context_note: Today, at about 19:45 hours, after the registration process in the Vial camp was over, 2 Team Members were involved in an incident, allegedly with locals. After attempting to leave the camp through the normal access, they had to return back due to demonstrations. During their second attempt to leave the area, in the surroundings of the camp, crowd intercepted their vehicle and started damaging the rental car (at least both mirrors are broken). After this incident, they managed to turn the car around and return back to Vial camp, where they remain to this point. The rest of the damages in the car still need to be assessed. Local Hellenic Police coordinator met with the affected TMS and provides all necessary support. None of the officers reported to suffer from any physical harm, yet they are affected by the incident.
records.evidence_quote: crowd intercepted their vehicle and started damaging the rental car (at least both mirrors are broken).

records.uncertainty_note: Specific coordinates removed, but general location (Mytilini, Lesvos) is clear from context.
records.context_note: During the night violent protests occurred in the port area of Mytilini when anti- riot Police tried to disembark the ferry from the mainland. Civilians tried to prevent the Anti- Riot Police to disembark. Teargas has been used. At this moment (25/02 11:00 LT) a peaceful demonstration of approx. 200-300 local people is taking place at the centre of Mytilini, Lesvos. The demonstration is against building the 'Multifunctional Control Centre' (MCC). There were also protests at Karava area during the night. Two crew members were travelling from Mytilini to the north of Lesvos. The road was blocked by approx. 30 demonstrators and HP Anti-Riot Police. One crew member was pushed by a demonstrator. Demonstrators were shouting and one of the demonstrators was kicking the right and the front of the vehicle, breaking a mirror and damaging the right door. Crew members were not injured. Major clashes between police forces and locals at Mantamados area. The roads are closed and the area should be avoided. FX Staff at Lesvos is informed about the situation and not allowed to travel in the direction north of Lesvos.
records.evidence_quote: Riot in Lesvos - FRONTEX patrol blocked by the demonstrators

records.context_note: During patrol activity on 20th of February 2020, one of the crew members, while attempting to take a towing rubber boat, slid off the stairs and injured his right leg knee. In the morning, the knee was swollen and an x-ray was taken during the hospital examination and nothing was broken, but according to the doctor, there was a possibility that the ligaments had stretched. A more detailed diagnosis would be given after 7 days of rest and cooling of the knee.
records.evidence_quote: one of the crew members, while attempting to take a towing rubber boat, slid off the stairs and injured his right leg knee.
